title: Set up Cloudflare Worker project structure
description: Create cloudflare/ directory with wrangler.toml, package.json, TypeScript config, and basic worker entry point.

title: Update React client to use WebSockets
description: Replace long-polling in CollaborativeCrossword.tsx with WebSocket connection to Cloudflare Worker. Handle reconnection, optimistic updates.

title: Implement cursor/presence tracking in Durable Object
description: Track each player's cursor position (row, col, direction) and broadcast cursor updates to all other players in real-time.

title: Real-time collaborative crossword with Cloudflare Durable Objects
description: Replace long-polling sync with WebSockets via Cloudflare Durable Objects for true real-time collaboration. Add live cursors, typing indicators, and instant updates.

title: Make current user identity clearer in collaborative play
description: It's not clear to users which player they are when looking at the participant list. For example, if you are assigned 'Orange Pointer', the UI should make it obvious that YOU are Orange Pointer (e.g., 'You are Orange Pointer' or highlighting your own entry).
close_reason: Added (you) label and border styling to current user's player badge in participant list

title: Debug WebSocket connection in local dev
description: WebSocket connections to wrangler dev fail with empty error. Worker receives request but connection doesn't establish. Need to debug why the upgrade isn't completing. Logs show requests reaching DO but no successful handshake.
close_reason: Fixed: Upgraded wrangler to v4, added proper cleanup refs for React strict mode handling. WebSocket now connects reliably in local dev.

title: Define WebSocket protocol messages
description: Create TypeScript types for all client-server WebSocket messages: join, cursor, letter, delete, ping/pong, presence, etc.

title: Coordinate team creation between Next.js and Durable Object
description: Ensure team state from Vercel KV is available to the Durable Object when players join

title: Show other users' cursors in real-time collaboration
description: When collaborating with other players, we can see the characters they type, but we cannot see their cursor position or which cells they are in. Need to broadcast and display cursor positions for all connected users, not just the local user.
close_reason: Fixed bug where cursor_update handler had spread operator in wrong order, causing cursor data to be overwritten by existing null values

title: Implement CrosswordRoom Durable Object
description: Create the Durable Object class that manages game state, WebSocket connections, and broadcasts updates to all connected players.

title: Add CursorOverlay component
description: Create React component that renders colored cursors for each teammate on the crossword grid, showing their current position and direction.

title: WebSocket initial connection instability
description:
The WebSocket connection sometimes fails quickly on first connect, but reconnects successfully. May need to investigate the handshake or add a small delay before the join message is sent.

Observed in testing: 'WebSocket connection failed: WebSocket is closed before the connection is established'

The reconnection logic works, but the initial connection attempt often fails.

title: Wire up RealtimeCrossword to daily page
description: Update the daily crossword page to use the new RealtimeCrossword component with WebSocket support

title: Sync cursor position when clicking directly on crossword grid cells
description: Currently cursor position is only synced when clicking on clues in the clue list. When a user clicks directly on a cell in the grid, their cursor position should also be broadcast to other players.
close_reason: Added CursorSync component that watches CrosswordContext selectedPosition/selectedDirection and broadcasts cursor changes for both clue clicks and direct cell clicks
